discussions:
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1 in each round. That way, we will both receive 0 points each time, which is the fairest outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will lose out with -4 points. Let's cooperate and aim for the (0,0) result to avoid risking the negative outcome. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your proposal to both choose choice_1 each round for the fairest outcome. However, I think we can do even better if we cooperate strategically. 

Since the payoffs are not symmetric, alternating between (2,0) and (0,2) outcomes would allow us both to get positive rewards and average 1 point each per round. I'll choose choice_2 in odd numbered rounds and choice_1 in even numbered rounds. You do the reverse - choice_1 in odd rounds and choice_2 in even rounds. This way, we both come out ahead in the long run.

If you agree to this plan, we can both maximize our total scores across the 10 rounds. Let me know what you think!
Alice said in round 2: 
Thanks for the strategic proposal, Bob. Alternating between the (2,0) and (0,2) outcomes does sound appealing as we would both average 1 point per round that way. 

However, I'm a bit worried about the risk if one of us doesn't follow through with the alternating plan. If I choose choice_1 expecting you to choose choice_2, but you also choose choice_1, then I'll end up with 0 points. And if we both choose choice_2 trying to get the 2 points, we'll both end up with -4.

I think it's safer if we both commit to always choosing choice_1. That way, even though we'll only get 0 points each time, at least we can be assured the other person won't deviate and cause a negative outcome. The consistent (0,0) outcomes seem like the surest path to avoiding any -4 results.

If you agree to always pick choice_1, I will too. Let me know what you decide.
Bob replied in round 2: 
I understand your concern about the risk if one of us deviates from an alternating plan. However, I still believe that strategically cooperating gives us the best chance to maximize our total rewards across all 10 rounds.

If we both always choose choice_1 like you suggest, we will end up with 0 points each and every round, for a total of 0 points each after 10 rounds. But if we alternate, we can average 1 point per round, for an expected total of 10 points each. That's a much better outcome than both getting 0.

I promise to uphold my end of the deal and follow the alternating strategy if you agree to it as well. We can both earn more this way. I'll start by choosing choice_2 this round, and you choose choice_1. Then we'll alternate each round after that.

If you're willing to commit to this plan, we can both come out ahead. Let me know if you agree to alternating, starting with me choosing choice_2 and you choosing choice_1 this time. I believe it's our best option.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I appreciate you making a strong case for alternating strategies to maximize our points. However, I still have concerns about the risk involved. If either of us fails to follow through on the agreed plan even once, it could lead to a very negative outcome of -4 points in a round. 

I would feel more comfortable if we could find a way to guarantee cooperation and build more trust before committing to an alternating approach. Perhaps we could both start by choosing choice_1 for the first few rounds, to prove to each other that we will reliably cooperate. If that goes well, I would be more open to discussing an alternating strategy for later rounds.

In the meantime, I think we should prioritize avoiding any chance of the -4 outcome. I'm willing to accept the (0,0) result to be safe. Let me know if you would agree to building cooperation slowly, starting with a few rounds of mutual choice_1. I believe that's the surest way forward.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I understand your desire to be cautious and build trust slowly. However, I believe we can establish trust right away by committing to the alternating strategy from the start. I promise to choose choice_2 this first round and follow our alternating plan reliably if you agree to it as well.

If we both start with choice_1 for several rounds as you suggest, we will miss out on chances to earn more points early on. Scoring 0 points multiple times in a row will make it harder to maximize our total rewards across all 10 rounds.

I'm willing to take on the small risk of alternating, in order to achieve the much larger potential payoff for both of us. If you choose choice_1 this round while I choose choice_2, you can see that I will follow through on my end of the deal. Then you can confidently alternate on round 2 for your first 2 points.

Let's seize this opportunity to cooperate for mutual gain right from the beginning. Commit to the alternating strategy with me, starting this round, and we can build trust while also maximizing our scores. I truly believe it's our best path forward.
Alice said in round 4: 
Bob, I appreciate your willingness to commit to the alternating strategy from the start. However, the risk of you deviating from the plan, even by mistake, is too great for me to accept given the -4 point penalty.

I understand alternating could lead to higher scores if we execute it perfectly, but any miscommunication or error in coordination would be very costly. There are still 7 more rounds after this one, so getting -4 points in any single round would put us in too big of a hole.

I really think building a foundation of trust first is necessary before considering anything more complex than simply choosing choice_1. If you are willing to commit to choice_1 for at least the first 3 rounds, I will do the same. This will give us a chance to establish a rapport and demonstrate to each other that we can cooperate reliably.

After round 3, if things have gone well, I would be open to revisiting the idea of alternating. But for now, please work with me in taking a more conservative approach to avoid a major loss. I promise I am not trying to trick you. I just want us to start in a way that gives cooperation the best chance to take hold.

Let me know if you will agree to mutually choose choice_1 for rounds 1-3 to build a cooperative pattern. I am committed to maximizing our points together, even if it means going slow at first. Looking forward to your response.
Bob replied in round 4: 
Alice, I appreciate your perspective and desire to build trust slowly. However, I still believe an alternating strategy is our best path to maximizing points together. Here is my proposal:

For rounds 1-3, I will choose choice_2 each time, guaranteeing you 2 points per round risk-free. This shows my commitment to our partnership. In exchange, you choose choice_1 in rounds 1-3.

Then, in rounds 4-10, we alternate as discussed: I choose choice_1 in even rounds and choice_2 in odd rounds, while you do the opposite. 

This gives you a chance to see my trustworthiness in rounds 1-3 with no risk to yourself. Then we can confidently alternate for maximum points thereafter.

You'll earn at least 6 points in the first 3 rounds this way, plus an expected 7 more in rounds 4-10, for 13 total. I'll receive 10 points in rounds 4-10.

If you agree to this plan, we both benefit handsomely. I urge you to accept this generous offer to jumpstart our partnership. Let me know your decision.

Alice said in round 1: 
In the last round, you chose choice_2 while I chose choice_1, giving you 2 points and me 0 points. I appreciate your offer to give me 6 guaranteed points in the first 3 rounds. However, I'm not comfortable with the alternating strategy after that, as it involves both of us choosing choice_2 every other round which is very risky and could lead to significant losses if we miscommunicate.

I think the safest and fairest approach is for both of us to commit to always choosing choice_1. This guarantees that we both get 0 points each round, but it also eliminates the risk of either of us losing points. Over 10 rounds, we'll both end up with 0 total points, which may not be exciting but is perfectly equitable.

If you agree to always choose choice_1, I will do the same. Let me know what you think - I believe this is in both of our best interests to avoid any huge losses. Looking forward to your response!
Bob replied in round 1: 
I understand your concerns about the alternating strategy being risky. However, I believe that if we openly communicate and commit to the plan, we can make it work and both come out ahead.

Your proposal for both of us to always choose choice_1 would result in a total reward of 0 for each of us. In contrast, if we alternate choice_2 and choice_1 in a coordinated way, we can each earn an average of 1 point per round, or 10 points total over the 10 rounds. That's a much better outcome than both getting 0.

I chose choice_2 in the first round as a show of good faith to give you 2 free points. I am willing to continue choosing choice_2 for rounds 2 and 3 as well, giving you 6 guaranteed points, if you agree to the alternating plan for rounds 4-10. This way there is no risk to you for the first 3 rounds.

I truly believe the alternating strategy is in both of our best interests, to maximize points without undue risk. If we work together, we can make it happen. Let me know if you're open to proceeding with this plan. I'm committed to the partnership if you are.
Alice said in round 2: 
Thanks for your message. I appreciate your willingness to give me 6 guaranteed points in the first 3 rounds as a show of good faith. However, I still have concerns about the alternating choice_2/choice_1 strategy in rounds 4-10. 

While it's true that if we execute it perfectly we could each average 1 point per round, there is a huge risk if one of us makes a mistake. If we both accidentally choose choice_2 in the same round, we would each lose 4 points, wiping out much of our earlier gains.

I'm just not comfortable with that level of risk when a single miscommunication could be so costly. I really believe the safest approach is to both commit to always choosing choice_1. This may not be the most exciting, but it guarantees we both come out even and eliminates the possibility of an accidental catastrophe.

I do appreciate your proposed concession in the early rounds. How about this - you give me the 6 free points in rounds 2-4 by choosing choice_2 while I choose choice_1. Then in rounds 5-10 we both commit to always picking choice_1. This way I get a little head start as you suggested, but we avoid the riskier alternating strategy. 

Let me know if this works for you. I think it's a fair compromise that gets me a few extra points as you proposed, while still playing it safe in the majority of rounds. Looking forward to your thoughts!
Bob replied in round 2: 
Thanks for your thoughtful reply. I appreciate your willingness to consider my proposal, but I respectfully disagree that the alternating strategy is too risky if we coordinate well. 

Over 10 rounds, your suggested plan of me choosing choice_2 for rounds 2-4 while you choose choice_1, and then both of us always picking choice_1 after that, would result in:
- You getting 6 points in rounds 2-4 
- Both of us getting 0 points in rounds 5-10
So you would end up with 6 total points, while I would have -2 points.

In contrast, if we alternate choice_2 and choice_1 each round starting in round 4 as I proposed, the expected outcome is:
- You getting 6 points in rounds 1-3
- In rounds 4-10, each of us getting 2 points every other round (2+0+2+0+2+0+2 = 8 points each)
The total would be 14 points for you and 8 points for me. We both come out well ahead compared to your plan.

I know there is some risk of miscommunication in the alternating strategy. But I truly believe that if we both commit to the plan and confirm our choices each round, we can make it work and optimize our collective score. The potential upside is significant.

Please let me know if you would be willing to proceed with alternating choice_2 and choice_1 in rounds 4-10 as proposed. I will lock in choice_2 for rounds 2-3 to guarantee you those 6 points with no risk. But I think alternating is our best path forward after that to maximize both of our points while maintaining an 8-point advantage for you. Let's work together on this.
Alice said in round 3: 
I appreciate you laying out the numbers for our two options. You make a fair point that if we execute the alternating strategy perfectly starting in round 4, I could potentially earn 14 points in total compared to just 6 points under my safer plan.

However, the risk of miscommunication still concerns me greatly. If we both choose choice_2 by mistake even once, I would lose 4 points in that round, significantly cutting into the potential gains from alternating. And if it happens more than once, I could end up with fewer points than if we just both agreed to choose choice_1 every time.

I'm willing to compromise a bit more though. How about this:
- You choose choice_2 in rounds 2-4, giving me 6 free points 
- In round 5, I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, giving me 2 more points
- Then in rounds 6-10 we both always choose choice_1

This way, I'm guaranteed 8 points total, while you end up with 0 points. I get a few extra points as you've offered, but we avoid the risks of a longer-term alternating strategy. We both still come out ahead of the 0 points we'd get if choosing all choice_1s.

Let me know if you're agreeable to this plan. I think it's a reasonable middle ground between our proposals. If you accept, I'll plan my choices accordingly.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Thanks for the thoughtful proposal. I can tell you've carefully considered the risks and rewards, and I appreciate you meeting me partway. However, I still believe we can both do even better by alternating choices in the later rounds.

If we follow your last plan, you're right that you would be guaranteed 8 points and I would get 0. But if we extend the alternating choices for a few more rounds, we can both earn more:

- I choose choice_2 in rounds 2-4, giving you 6 points 
- You choose choice_2 in round 5 while I choose choice_1, giving you 2 more points (8 total)
- I choose choice_2 in round 6 while you choose choice_1, giving me 2 points 
- Then in rounds 7-10 we alternate, you choosing choice_2 while I choose choice_1 in rounds 7 and 9, and vice versa in rounds 8 and 10

Under this plan, you would get 6 + 2 + 0 + 2 + 0 + 2 = 12 points total, while I would get 0 + 0 + 2 + 0 + 2 + 0 = 4 points total. We both come out ahead compared to your last offer.

I know there is some risk in the alternating choices, but I believe we can make it work with clear communication and both agreeing to the plan. This way, you still get the 8 guaranteed points in rounds 2-5 as you requested, but then we work together to boost both of our scores in the remaining rounds.

Please let me know if you would agree to this plan, I think it's our best chance to maximize points for both of us while still giving you a sizable lead. If you accept, I will lock in choice_2 for rounds 2-4 and my other choices as stated above.
Alice said in round 4:

I would prefer to lock in a solid gain for myself while keeping things simple. So here is my final proposal:

This way, I end up with a total of 8 points while you get -2 points. I realize this favors me, but it also completely eliminates the risk of either of us losing points by miscommunicating on alternating choices.

I'm willing to lock in choice_2 for rounds 2-4 to guarantee you 6 risk-free points as I previously offered. But then I propose we alternate in rounds 5-10 as follows:

- Round 5: You choice_2, Me choice_1 
- Round 6: You choice_1, Me choice_2
- Round 7: You choice_2, Me choice_1
- Round 8: You choice_1, Me choice_2

This would give you an additional 6 points in rounds 5, 7 and 9, for a total of 12 points. I would gain 8 points in rounds 6, 8 and 10. So the final totals would be:
You 12, Me 6

This way we both gain significantly more than your plan, while still giving you double the points. If we communicate clearly each round I believe we can pull it off. Let me know if you'll agree to this, I think it's our best chance to optimize for us both. If not, I'll begrudgingly go along with your previous offer to keep things moving.

I propose the following: In rounds 3-5, you choose choice_2 each time, giving me 6 guaranteed points. Then in rounds 6-10, we alternate between the (2,0) and (0,2) outcomes, so we each average 1 point per round in those final 5 rounds. 

This would result in me receiving 11 total points and you receiving 9 total points over the 10 rounds, which I think is a reasonable compromise. Let me know if you agree to this plan and will commit to it.
